title: M5 closed after crash with hour-long delays and 6 MILES of queues for drivers
description: A MAJOR motorway has been closed after a horrifying collision this morning. Drivers have been told to expect delays of up to an hour, as mammoth six mile queues continue to build. The collision is …
content:
Although traffic has started moving, delays are ongoing

ROAD BLOCK M5 closed after crash with hour-long delays and 6 MILES of traffic for thousands of drivers sparking rush-hour chaos

A MAJOR motorway has been closed after a horrifying collision this morning.

Drivers have been told to expect delays of up to an hour, as mammoth six mile queues continue to build.

The collision is affecting the M5 Southbound between Junction 16 and Junction 17.

The road's closure and the resulting delays have thrown thousands of Monday morning, rush hour journeys into chaos.

Although the road has been reopened, National Highways has warned drivers to expect ongoing delays.

A statement from the organisation read: "All lanes have now re-opened on the #M5 southbound between J16 and J17 near #Almondsbury #Bristol.

"A 52 minute delay and 6 miles of congestion remains in the area but should now start to ease.

"Thanks for your patience this morning."

More to follow... For the latest news on this story keep checking back at The Sun Online

summary: The M5 in the UK has been closed due to a collision causing significant delays and 6 MILES of traffic. The M5 Southbound between Junction 16 and Junction 17 has been reopened, but motorists are warned to expect delays of up to an hour. The collision has resulted in significant traffic delays and six mile queues. National Highways has issued a statement thanking drivers for their patience and stating that all lanes have now reopened, although congestion remains at a 52-minute delay and 6 miles of congestion.
shortSummary: A major motorway was closed due to a massive crash, causing hour-long delays and 6 miles of congestion, despite it being reopened.
argos_summary: The M5 motorway has reopened after a serious collision caused significant delays, with traffic queues extending six miles and wait times reaching up to an hour. The incident affected the southbound lanes between Junction 16 and Junction 17, leading to chaos during the Monday morning rush hour. Although the road is now clear, National Highways has warned that congestion and delays may persist.
